definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end
USB flash drive/see also 閃存盤|闪存盘[shan3 cun2 pan2]

sentences.english: I got a splinter in my finger while I was moving the boxes.
sentences.chinese: 我在搬箱子的时候手指头上扎了一根刺。

sentences.english: He clipped an electronic pulse reader tohis finger.
sentences.chinese: 他把电子脉搏计夹到手指上。

sentences.english: I still tend to move my fingers, almost subconsciously, when doing arithmetic.
sentences.chinese: 当做算术时，几乎是下意识的，我还是会想去掰手指。

sentences.english: Our opposable thumbs, as we call them, allow us to work with our fingers.
sentences.chinese: 我们的对生拇指，使得我们可以使用手指工作。

sentences.english: The team found the sense of ownership still occurred when participants' fingers were anaesthetized.
sentences.chinese: 研究人员发现当受试者的手指被麻醉时，仍有感知。

sentences.english: With strong and thick bodies, the characters appear abstract and simple and their hands either stretch or clench.
sentences.chinese: 人物身条浑厚，手指若伸若握，抽象简洁。

sentences.english: What vitamin or what is that split to lack on the side of fingernail?
sentences.chinese: 手指甲旁边那块裂开了是缺少什么维生素还是什么啊？

sentences.english: The magician riffled through the cards with skilful fingers that moved like lightning.
sentences.chinese: 魔术师用熟练的手指闪电般地洗牌。

sentences.english: The tips of my fingers are cold.
He bellowed in pain when the hammer came down on his finger.
sentences.chinese: 当铁锤砸到手指时，他痛得大叫。

sentences.english: A finger or stylus interrupts the light beams and position is determined on the grid.
sentences.chinese: 一只手指或者尖笔打断轻的梁，位置是决定闸极栏。

sentences.english: Take care to avoid to put your fingers on polished surface.
sentences.chinese: 小心避免安装时别将手指碰到阀内磨光面上。

sentences.english: After some furious finger tapping on the keyboard of a Personal Digital Assistant, Fei Fei leaned back in her chair.
sentences.chinese: 菲菲的手指在便携式电脑键盘上飞快地敲着。

sentences.english: The workman had a finger cut off by the machine he was operating.
sentences.chinese: 工人被他所操作的机器切去一只手指。

sentences.english: He straightened his back, his fingers freeing nylon line from a speedily revolving reel.
sentences.chinese: 他直起腰身，用手指快速地从绕线轮上放出尼龙线。

sentences.english: Playing the cymbals can get fingers trained to work independently and build strength.
sentences.chinese: 敲打铜钹可以训练手指灵活性和力量。
